question_body.question: Identify whether the following statement is true or false? “Overfitting is more likely when the set of training data is small”
Which of the following criteria is typically used for optimizing in linear regression.

options.value: Maximize the number of points it toucheMinimize the number of points it toucheMinimize the squared distance from the pointMinimize the maximum distance of a point from a lin

question_body.question: Which of the following is false?

options.value: Bias is the true error of the best classifier in the concept class
Bias is high if the concept class cannot model the true data distribution well
For high bias both train and test error will be high

question_body.question:
The following dataset will be used to learn a decision tree for predicting whether a person
is happy (H) or sad (S), based on the color of shoes, whether they wear a wig and the
number of ears they have.Which attribute should you choose as the root of the decision tree?

options.value: Any one of the previous three attributes

question_body.question:
In a binary classification problem, out of 64 data points 29 belong to class I and 35 belong to
class II. What is the entropy of the data set?

Decision trees can be used for the following type of datasets:
I. The attributes are categorical
II. The attributes are numeric valued and continuous
III. The attributes are discrete valued numbers

options.value: In cases II and III only
In cases I, II and III

question_body.question: What is true for Stochastic Gradient Descent?

options.value: In every iteration, model parameters are updated for multiple training samples
In every iteration, model parameters are updated for one training sample
In every iteration, model parameters are updated for all training samples
